responses.text: Now that your guitar is fixed, could you play something for me?
That's a nice guitar you have.

yes.gendered_line: Well now, good to see you again, friend.

yes: Nice of you to come around <u_name>.
dynamic_line.no: Good to see people like you in the world.  I'm Sonia, Sonia Greene.  I entertain the people.

responses.text: Sonia?  Nice to meet you, I'm <u_name>.  How are things here?
Hey Sonia.  I can't stay to talk right now.

dynamic_line.yes: Just playing some good ol' tunes.  There's so much negativity around here, someone's gotta cheer people up, ya know?
dynamic_line.no: Nothin' much, just sitting around and biding my time,, getting any work I can.  I might play something to cheer everyone up, if my guitar wasn't busted.

responses.text: Is there anything I can help you with?

dynamic_line: You're <swear> right.  I like its scars, makes it look like it has a history, you know?  We've been through a lot.  Those pesky <zombies> forced me to harm my sweet, sweet guitar, but I retaliated and bashed their heads in!  I lost a part of me that day, but the guitar's alright.  Just a bit rusted from all that blood and gore, that's all.
Now that's a wild story.  I owe my life to this kid Chloe, really.  I'll let her tell the tale.

I was in an underground band - Taurists was our name - before all this.  Performing gigs at local venues and jamming with my friends; that's all my life was about.  Now, I'm a badass soloist with a war-torn guitar, a singer of the old-world preserving the wonders of music and the Taurist legacy for generations to come.  That's also a synonym for not having all that much going on in my life.

Oh, just fine.  A bit malnourished and all, but I can't really complain if that's the worst of it, right?  My guitar makes our twisted little world a bit more tolerable, though.  Takes my mind off stuff and muffles the screams of the boogeyman, you know?

Fairly?  There's no such thing as fairness in the world.  The NECC wouldn't give a damn if I starved to death on this very bench.  At least I have friends here, ones that appreciate what I do.  I make music and that's all I have left, it means everything to me.
Sure, I can play you a tune or two that I know.  It will cost you a little something, just one icon.  The artist doesn't want to starve, if you know what I mean.
